use_cases.title: User Registration and Authentication
use_cases.description: This use case allows new users to create an account and authenticate securely, incorporating OAuth 2.0 for third-party integrations and ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations like GDPR and CCPA. It aligns with best practices for robust data security and user-centric design.
preconditions: User has access to the app via a compatible device (iOS or Android).
main_flow: User launches the app and selects 'Sign Up' or 'Log In'.
For new users, user provides email, password, and consents to privacy policy and terms.
System validates input and creates account, sending verification email.
User verifies email and completes profile setup, including age and fitness goals.
For authentication, user enters credentials or uses OAuth via Google/Apple.
System authenticates user and grants access to dashboard.
alternate_flows: If email is already registered, system prompts for login instead.
If OAuth fails, fallback to manual login.
postconditions: User is logged in with a secure session.
Profile data is stored encrypted in compliance with AES-256.
use_cases.business_value: Ensures secure access and builds trust through privacy compliance, differentiating from competitors by offering seamless OAuth integration like Google Fit.

use_cases.title: Activity Tracking and Real-Time Feedback
use_cases.description: Users can track physical activities such as steps, heart rate, and workouts with wearable integration via HealthKit or Google Fit APIs. Incorporates AI for personalized insights and real-time progress visualization, addressing user expectations for accuracy and minimal battery drain.
preconditions: Wearable device is paired and permissions granted.
main_flow: User starts an activity (e.g., run) via app or wearable.
App syncs data in real-time from wearable using IoT ecosystems.
System tracks metrics like steps, heart rate, and calories burned.
App provides real-time feedback, such as pace alerts or hydration reminders.
User ends activity, and system saves data with AI-generated summary insights.
alternate_flows: If wearable is unavailable, manual input option is provided.
If data sync fails, offline storage and later sync upon connection.
postconditions: Activity data is recorded and visualized on dashboard.
User receives personalized recommendations based on historical data.
use_cases.business_value: Drives user engagement through accurate tracking and AI insights, competing with Fitbit's advanced wearables by offering scalable, cloud-based synchronization.

use_cases.title: Personalized Workout and Nutrition Recommendations
use_cases.description: Leveraging AI and machine learning, the app provides tailored workout plans and nutrition advice based on user goals and data. Includes holistic wellness by integrating mental health prompts, aligning with industry trends and competitor strengths like MyFitnessPal.
preconditions: User has completed initial profile with goals and preferences.
main_flow: User accesses recommendations section.
AI analyzes user data (activities, nutrition logs, mental health entries).
System generates personalized workout plan and meal suggestions.
User receives notifications for daily tasks, including mental health check-ins.
User can customize or accept recommendations.
alternate_flows: If insufficient data, system prompts for more input before generating recommendations.
Fallback to generic plans if AI processing fails.
postconditions: User has a customized plan integrated into their dashboard.
Progress is tracked towards goals with predictive insights.
use_cases.business_value: Enhances retention through personalization, differentiating by combining physical and mental wellness, surpassing competitors' focus on single aspects.

use_cases.title: Social Sharing and Gamified Challenges
use_cases.description: Users can share achievements, join challenges, and compete socially, incorporating gamification elements like rewards and leaderboards. This fosters motivation and community, inspired by Strava's social features and industry trends in engagement.
preconditions: User is authenticated and has activity data.
main_flow: User selects share option for an activity or achievement.
System posts to social feed with privacy controls.
User browses and joins challenges (e.g., step count goals).
App tracks progress and awards badges or points.
Leaderboards update in real-time via cloud synchronization.
alternate_flows: If user opts out of sharing, data remains private.
Group challenges allow inviting friends via app.
postconditions: Engagement metrics improve, with rewards redeemed.
use_cases.business_value: Boosts motivation and virality, positioning the app as a community hub to compete with Strava's dominance in social fitness.

use_cases.title: Data Privacy and Settings Management
use_cases.description: Users manage their data privacy, including consent, data portability, and deletion, ensuring compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and HIPAA. Incorporates transparent policies and encryption, addressing rising regulatory focus and user expectations for trust.
main_flow: User accesses privacy settings in the app.
System displays current consents and data usage policies.
User updates preferences, such as opting out of data sharing.
For requests, system processes data export or deletion.
System confirms changes and logs for audit compliance.
alternate_flows: If under 13, COPPA restrictions apply, limiting features.
Admin reviews high-risk changes for security audits.
postconditions: Data is handled ethically with end-to-end encryption.
use_cases.business_value: Builds user trust and avoids regulatory fines, differentiating through best-in-class privacy controls amid industry trends in ethical data use.

use_cases.title: Third-Party Integrations and Ecosystem Sync
use_cases.description: The app integrates with external apps and devices via open APIs, enabling seamless data aggregation like Apple Health. This supports a unified experience, leveraging technical standards and competitor insights from Google Fit.
main_flow: User selects integration options in settings.
App connects via RESTful APIs (e.g., Google Fit).
Data from third-party sources syncs automatically.
System aggregates and displays unified health dashboard.
User receives cross-app insights and notifications.
alternate_flows: If API fails, manual sync option provided.
Fallback to app-only mode if integrations are disabled.
use_cases.business_value: Enhances ecosystem value and user loyalty, competing with Apple Health by offering open, scalable integrations for broader accessibility.

business_requirements.overview: The Fitness Tracking App project aims to develop a comprehensive mobile application that leverages AI, wearable integrations, and gamification to provide personalized fitness and wellness tracking. It incorporates industry trends like holistic wellness and data privacy, while differentiating through seamless ecosystems and ethical data practices, targeting market leaders like Fitbit and Strava.
business_goals: Achieve 20% market share in the fitness app segment within two years by offering superior personalization and integrations.
Increase user retention by 30% through gamified features and real-time feedback.
Ensure compliance with global regulations to build trust and avoid penalties.
Foster a scalable platform for third-party partnerships and monetization via premium features.
success_criteria: Daily Active Users (DAU) exceeding 1 million within 12 months.
User retention rate of 70% after 30 days.
Positive app store ratings above 4.5 stars based on usability and privacy.
Successful integration with at least 5 major wearable brands and health apps.
constraints: Development must adhere to technical standards like HealthKit, OAuth 2.0, and AES-256 encryption.
Budget limited to $5 million, prioritizing scalable cloud architecture (e.g., AWS).
Timeline: MVP launch in 6 months, full release in 12 months.
Compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, CCPA, and COPPA without exceptions.
assumptions: Users have smartphones with iOS/Android and access to wearables.
AI models will be trained on anonymized data to ensure ethical use.
Beta testing will involve diverse groups to refine features.
Cloud services will handle peak loads without downtime.

risks.mitigation: Implement end-to-end encryption, regular security audits (ISO 27001), and transparent policies.

risks.risk: Competition from established players like Fitbit.
risks.mitigation: Differentiate through AI-driven personalization and open APIs for broader integrations.
Conduct legal reviews and embed compliance checks in development cycles.

risks.risk: Scalability issues with growing user data.
risks.mitigation: Use scalable backend (AWS/Firebase) and conduct load testing.
